aquarium.creatures

Interface Creature

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    LineSwimmer, PaintedCreature

    public interface Creature
    A Creature inhabits an Aquarium and primarily has a name, location, and appearance. Implement this interface to create a Creature that can swim in the Aquarium and animate according to the Aquarium's timeline.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.awt.image.BufferedImage getAppearance()
      Gets the image that can be used to render this Creature's appearance.
      java.awt.Point getLocation()
      Gets the location of the center point of this Creature.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Gets the friendly name of this Creature.
      void hitClouds()
      Event method called by the Aquarium to indicate that the Creature has touched or passed the top of the sky area.
      void hitFloor()
      Event method called by the Aquarium to indicate that the Creature has touched or passed the floor (bottom).
      void hitLeftWall()
      Event method called by the Aquarium to indicate that the Creature has touched or passed the left wall.
      void hitRightWall()
      Event method called by the Aquarium to indicate that the Creature has touched or passed the right wall.
      void hitSurface()
      Event method called by the Aquarium to indicate that the Creature is touching the water's surface.
      void updateLocation()
      Causes the Creature to move in some way.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the friendly name of this Creature.
        Returns:
        The name of this Creature.

      • getLocation

        java.awt.Point getLocation()
        Gets the location of the center point of this Creature.
        Returns:
        The Point with the coordinates of the center point.

      • getAppearance

        java.awt.image.BufferedImage getAppearance()
        Gets the image that can be used to render this Creature's appearance.
        Returns:
        The BufferedImage used to paint this Creature.

      • updateLocation

        void updateLocation()
        Causes the Creature to move in some way. getLocation can be used to retrieve the updated location afterwards.
        See Also:
        getLocation, Aquarium.updateCreatureLocations()

      • hitLeftWall

        void hitLeftWall()
        Event method called by the Aquarium to indicate that the Creature has touched or passed the left wall.
        See Also:
        Aquarium.updateCreatureLocations()

      • hitRightWall

        void hitRightWall()
        Event method called by the Aquarium to indicate that the Creature has touched or passed the right wall.
        See Also:
        Aquarium.updateCreatureLocations()

      • hitFloor

        void hitFloor()
        Event method called by the Aquarium to indicate that the Creature has touched or passed the floor (bottom).
        See Also:
        Aquarium.updateCreatureLocations()

      • hitSurface

        void hitSurface()
        Event method called by the Aquarium to indicate that the Creature is touching the water's surface.
        See Also:
        Aquarium.updateCreatureLocations()

      • hitClouds

        void hitClouds()
        Event method called by the Aquarium to indicate that the Creature has touched or passed the top of the sky area.
        See Also:
        Aquarium.updateCreatureLocations()
